results.title: Ant world
results.brief_description: Shows the life style of the common ant. Tells how the class structure of certain ant colonies constitutes a society based on a division of labour. Records home-building and food-gathering techniques and documents the exchange of a salivery substance between a smaller male and larger female ant. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.description: Shows the life style of the common ant. Tells how the class structure of certain ant colonies constitutes a society based on a division of labour. results.title: Answering the child's 'why'
results.brief_description: This film brings to light important aspects of the period when the child begins to ask questions. Our answers to their questions go far toward shaping their development as participants in our democratic society. How we answer these questions, therefore, is of vital importance. The film dramatizes true-to-life situations in which youngsters meet with positive or negative attitudes toward their questions and suggests the resulting effects on their personalities.

results.title: Another viewpoint
results.brief_description: Intended for prospective migrants to Australia from Europe. Shows the reactions and impressions of various immigrants. It is emphasised that Australia is a predominantly suburban society.

results.title: Another case of poisoning
results.creator_credit: John Waterhouse, Richard Massingham and Great Britain. Ministry of Health
results.brief_description: A film for food handlers of all kinds. A warning against the risks of food infection through neglect of the simple rules of hygiene. A food handler, suffering from poisoning is questioned by a doctor. The man recapitulates the events which led up to his illness. The film points out, by looking at the various locations he visited where food was handled, how he may have been infected due to dirty utensils, and unhealthy habits on the parts of cooks and food servers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Waterhouse, Richard Massingham and Great Britain. Ministry of Health

results.title: Another beginning
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Captures the Ballet Russe from its beginnings in Monte Carlo through its tour of Great Britain (1933) and later of Australia in 1936. The commentator, Wilfrid Thomas, discusses the impact of the Australian tour for the development of dance in Australia. Included are scenes from rehearsals of the Australian Ballet Company.

results.title: Anoop and the elephant
results.creator_credit: David Eady, Hugh Stewart, Anvil Films and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Engaging and highly entertaining children’s adventure story set in the world of the circus. Anoop, an Indian boy, and his friends attempt to rescue a performing elephant (Riley) from a life in the circus. Cast includes Jimmy Edwards.

results.title: Annie's Coming Out (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A warm, moving film experience and a triumph of the human spirit. “Annie’s Coming Out” is based on the true story of Annie McDonald. Jessica Hathaway (Angela Punch McGregor) works at a hospital for handicapped children, and among her charges is Annie, a victim of cerebral palsy. Discovering Annie’s considerable intelligence, Jessica endeavours to prove this and must take her case to court in a battle against the establishment.

results.title: Annelid worms
results.brief_description: The following are studied: land earthworms, freshwater and saltwater aquatic worms; medicinal and pond leeches; numerous marine polchaet worms; and the most primitive type of annelid larva is illustrated by a study of the trochophore larva. No other credits available.

results.title: Anna Who?
results.creator_credit: Pip Karmel and South Australian College of Advanced Education
results.brief_description: A film which dispels the myth that Anorexia Nervosa is a slimmers disease affecting only figure conscious women. Five young people (four women and one man) talk frankly about their experience of Anorexia and Bulimia, the factors in the cause and progress of the disease, and the road to recovery.
